About Ancestry:  When you join Ancestry, you join a human-centered company where every person’s story is important. We believe that by discovering the struggles and triumphs of our past, we can foster deeper bonds and more meaningful connections among families and communities. Our talented team of scientists, engineers, genealogists, historians, and storytellers is dedicated to empowering customers around the world from all backgrounds on their journeys of personal discovery. With more than 30+ billion digitized global historical records, 100+ million family trees, and 20+ million people in our growing AncestryDNA database, Ancestry helps customers discover their family story and gain a new level of understanding about their lives. Passionate about dedicating your work to enriching people’s lives? You belong at Ancestry. We are growing our Data Science team globally. We're looking for a Senior Manager of Data Science Engineering to join our team at our headquarters in beautiful Lehi, Utah. You will manage a group of accomplished data science engineers in both San Francisco and Lehi locations. Reporting directly to the Senior Director or Data Science Engineering, you and your team will build an important, production-ready platform used to build and deploy models to solve our toughest data science challenges. You will lead the creation of AI-driven solutions using creative methods/technologies, partner with product, platform, marketing, and other partners to identify/prioritize opportunities, create business/technical requirements, and to bring customer value What you will do... Lead the team in building production quality, customer-facing, recommendation and search ML services, and its components Work with data scientists, engineers, product managers, and partners to understand our needs for our ML-motivated recommendations and search domains Help promote a data-driven culture and push long-term value creation through development of outstanding data science capabilities Help pushing for a customer-centric vision for Ancestry across different business products Who you are... You demonstrated an ability to manage an experienced, distributed team of engineers at the different stages of their career. 10+ years of relevant work experience, out of which at least 3+ years of experience managing technical teams You have a collaborative work style that's open to discussion, idea sharing, and feedback You have an experience developing customer-facing ML search and recommendation platform You have knowledge of AWS best practices Experience building production quality distributed ML systems for applications with a very large number of users, and Service level agreement requirements Experience working with big data, Spark/databricks and other relevant frameworks is very helpful You have industry experience with, and experience of:  Java, Python, SQL, Harness, Jenkins, and other tools commonly used in the back-end cloud development and ML infrastructure. Working knowledge or good understanding of computer vision, NLP, search, recommendation and other ML strategies Experience with ML/Kaggle is not required but gives you an edge A degree in Computer Science or related technical field from a reputable college/university, or appropriate work experience, is required An interest in family history Helping people discover their story is at the heart of ours. Ancestry is the largest provider of family history and personal DNA testing, harnessing a powerful combination of information, science and technology to help people discover their family history and stories that were never possible before. Ancestry’s suite of products includes: AncestryDNA, AncestryProGenealogists, Fold3, Newspapers.com , Find a Grave, Archives.com , and Rootsweb. We offer excellent benefits and a competitive compensation package. For additional information, regarding our benefits and career information, please visit our website at http://ancestry.com/careers #GDSponsored #IND2 #LI-MK1 Additional Information:  Ancestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition, Ancestry will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. All job offers are contingent on a background check screen that complies with applicable law. For San Francisco office candidates, pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Ancestry will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ancestry via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ancestry. POSITION SUMMARY This position is a high-level individual contributor with expertise in selected business or healthcare processes and participates in formulating system scope and objectives relative to the company’s requirements. The incumbent participates in meetings, presentations, visioning sessions, planning sessions, implementation activities, and supports functions system wide. Acts independently or as a leader of a team to provide knowledge, guidance, research and fact- finding expertise to define, design and modify specifications and processes of complex information systems. Responsible for establishing system documentation standards and quality assurance methodologies for systems and applications. Maintains current professional and technical knowledge.  CORE FUNCTIONS 1. Business Outcomes: Relentless focus on delivering outcomes and value to our business. Partners across organization and related functional areas to understand internal customer needs related to service excellence, including but not limited to analytical, technology and reporting needs; determine the appropriate course of action; make recommendations in an actionable format including to senior management, to achieve desired business results. Facilitates cross-functional teams and/or leads projects with departmental or company-wide scope to implement system changes. This may also include providing oversight, change management, general work direction or leadership to individuals on team; conducts regular meetings with stake holders and uploads necessary documents to the shared information repositories, such as SharePoint or Teams. 2. Technology Standards: Establishes and defines processes, documentation and standards for quality, and provides expert advice to ensure adherence to critical operating standards; mentors junior members of the team; Provides leadership for customers, information technology staff and various committees guiding the design, implementation and maintenance of complex application and system specifications and processes. Participates and may lead task forces to plan, implement, and coordinate facility activities to maximize information technology service quality, effectiveness and efficiency. 3. Innovation and Futures: Analyzes and reports on complex customer needs. Manages and supports the identification and research of new developments and uses of current systems and applications, as well as upgraded systems and applications. 4. Advisor & Partner: Develops strong relationships with internal and business partners; collaborate in appropriate areas, including application design, system optimization, programming complex models, transferring large data feeds, and staying current on emerging technology related to all systems. 5. Communication: Presents information or ideas to the interests, level and needs of the audience. Actively engages participants and encourages input. Uses group process skills to ensure that the agenda is met. Promotes and facilitates free and open communication. Adapts choice of language and presentation of ideas to fit various needs and perspectives of audiences. 6. Measurements: Ensures Key Performance Indicators are developed and tracked in all levels of work effort. Clearly defines success and implements the measurements to understand when success is achieved. 7. Strategic: Designs and administers complex standards and policies regarding application and end user customer documentation. Ensures that department and company standards are implemented. 8. This position has responsibility for selected area of responsibility. Work is performed in a fast-paced multi-tasked environment where there may be conflicting priorities or tight deadlines. The incumbent must have significant knowledge about cross functional departments in order to serve as a liaison and provide relevant guidance or leadership. The incumbent has collaborative decision-making authority for projects and applications and works at peer and leader levels. The incumbent may also be expected to troubleshoot issues at a complex level and appropriately escalate issues to other resources, as needed. The incumbent participates in meetings, presentations, visioning sessions, planning sessions, implementation activities, and supports functions system wide. May be responsible for leading cross functional teams using project management skills to achieve desired results. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS  Must possess strong technical and business knowledge as typically obtained through the completion of Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Epidemiology, Computer Sciences, Process Engineering, Business, Healthcare, Information systems or related field. A minimum of four to seven years of experience or equivalent as typically obtained in one or multiple areas: reporting and/or analytics in clinical, financial, insurance, utilization, patient satisfaction, supply chain, HR, clinical application configuration, or related field. Must possess significant knowledge of cross functional departments in order to serve as a liaison and provide relevant guidance or leadership. Must possess strong project management skills and ability to work independently, manage large, multiple projects, complex reports, while organizing priorities. Excellent communication, interpersonal and critical thinking skills are required. Strong technical skills as appropriate for position (SQL/Ansi SQL, SAS, Tableau, Excel, clinical software applications, etc.). PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Experience with system implementation and project management. Additional experience with specialized applications in related area also preferred. Experience with department specific software (Cerner, NextGen, Centricity, TSI, and Quality Advisor, SAS or SSRS), including advanced integrated or independent report writing applications. Master’s degree or higher in relevant field. Advanced knowledge in area of expertise.  Additional related education and/or experience preferred.

Job Description: As a  Senior   Data Analyst - Sales Operations (Remote) , you will be responsible for the supporting sales staff through reporting, analytics, and insights. You will need to learn and gain a full understanding of Progressive Leasing's business relating to our sales team, customers, partners, and operational/financial performance. You will be responsible for providing a cross-functional forecast, assisting in setting accurate sales quotas and territory management. This role can be performed remotely anywhere in the US or from one of our office locations in Draper, UT or Glendale, AZ. The Company’s mission is to provide simple and affordable purchase options for credit challenged consumers. Over the last 20+ years, Progressive Leasing’s alternative lease-purchase options have helped millions of customers with less than perfect credit acquire needed items with ease. Progressive partners with 30,000 retail stores, helping to drive increased revenue and improve customer satisfaction. Learn more at ProgLeasing.com. Progressive Leasing welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Progressive Leasing does business.

Overview: Guidehouse is a leading global provider of consulting services to the public and commercial markets with broad capabilities in management, technology, and risk consulting. We help clients address their toughest challenges and navigate significant regulatory pressures with a focus on transformational change, business resiliency, and technology-driven innovation. Guidehouse is a Veritas Capital portfolio company, led by seasoned professionals with proven and diverse expertise in traditional and emerging technologies, markets, and agenda-setting issues driving national and global economies. For more information, please visit: www.guidehouse.com. Responsibilities: This position is for the AFNWC ICBM Directorate ISC 2.0 project. Uses classical and modern statistical methods.  Analyzes and interprets data from various sources. Compiles reports, charts, and tables based on established statistical methods. Performs a variety of complex tasks similar to the following: post flight analyses of missile trajectories, using least squares and filtering techniques, error analyses of guidance hardware and software, reentry aerodynamics statistics, modeling and simulation, etc. Performs statistical analysis for accuracy assessment on missile systems for Air Force ICBMs. Collaborates with multi-disciplinary teams. VP Area   U of U Health - Academics   Department   01651 - DEPT OF PEDIATRICS RSCH PILOTS   Location   Campus   City   Salt Lake City, UT   Type of Recruitment   External Posting   Pay Rate Range   $60,700 to $101,649   Close Date   Open Until Filled   Yes   Job Summary  Guides and participates in data and information management for clinical and epidemiological research studies including the Environmental Influences on Child Health Outcomes (ECHO) and Utah Children’s Project (UCP) research studies. Candidate should be familiar with research data management environments, including data coordinating center and HIPAA protected environments. Participate directly, or oversee study longitudinal data management, database and information architecture/infrastructure, reports and analysis, and scripting/development of automated tasks. Works with currently supported technologies (Microsoft SQL Server, Python, R, or SAS), applications and platforms (OpenSpecimen, REDCap), and existing technology resource groups within the University of Utah (Pediatrics, Huntsman Cancer Institute, Clinical Trials Office, Center for Clinical and Translational Science, Center for High Performance Computing). Facilitates quality assurance of data, linkage and exchange of data between relevant systems, extraction and linkage of data from electronic medical records and data warehouses and development of novel resources for entering or managing data, such as a web portal, as needed. Works with other qualified research personnel to meet these project needs. Investigates and makes recommendations for choices for updates or changes of applications and platforms.  About the University: Located in Salt Lake City, in the foothills of the Wasatch Mountains, the University of Utah is the ﬂagship institution of the State of Utah’s system of higher education. Salt Lake City combines the amenities of a major metropolitan area of more than one million people with the friendliness and ease of living of a small, Western city. Seven major ski resorts are within an hour’s drive from campus, and opportunities to pursue activities from biking to hiking to fishing abound. Salt Lake is also home to the Utah Symphony and Opera, the Utah Ballet, several professional sports teams, and a wide range of other cultural and recreational activities. For more information about working at the University, including employment benefits, please visit https://www.hr.utah.edu/careers/staff/work.php.  The University of Utah provides a variety of excellent employee benefits, including health care coverage, retirement plans, and paid leave time. Current benefit information is available at www.hr.utah.edu/benefits. A few specific highlights are:  Immediately vested retirement 14.2% retirement contribution that is 100%-paid by the University, nothing required from the employee Extensive healthcare options Generous paid time off Paid Holidays (https://www.hr.utah.edu/benefits/holiday.php) Flexible work schedule (with some telecommuting options)   Responsibilities  1. Contributes to the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of current and future systems supporting clinical and epidemiological research projects;  2. Collaborate in the development and maintenance of data systems using a combination of specimen management/tracking solutions, Electronic Data Capture (EDC) software, extraction of data from electronic medical records or data warehouses, and other internal or commercial tools;  3. Manage quality, consistency, format, storage, and reporting of project data, including working with statisticians, investigators, and other analysts in a secure, timely fashion;  4. Participate in the development of front-end and back-end applications to support the full spectrum of clinical research needs, including recruitment, tracking, data acquisition, and data analytics;  5. Work directly with researchers and project team members to help organize responsibilities, adhere to timelines, and meet deliverables;  6. Work as part of a team in operational data analysis, quality, and preparation of data for scientific analysis;  7. Bulk import, export and manipulation of data from prior database systems, electronic medical records, and/or data warehouses;  8. Make recommendations for existing databases and data management systems or direct/coordinate with programmers and analysts to make changes. Ensure systems are in compliance with regulatory, study-specific, and University policies;  9. Identify and evaluate industry trends in information management and database systems to serve as a resource of information and advice to investigators; and,  10. Communicate clearly and proactively with other personnel within the research projects, at the University, and outside the University (including project sponsors) to accomplish all essential functions. Four to six years of experience in the field or in a related area required.  This position is patient-sensitive and must fulfill all associated requirements. Limited exemptions may be made for documented medical contraindications or religious beliefs that object to vaccinations. Preferences  Master’s degree in related field (bioinformatics, health information systems, statistics, computer science, public health) or Bachelor’s degree with commensurate experience  Demonstrated data and information management skills  Experience with clinical research study operations  Good relationship, communication, and organization skills  Human subject biomedical research  Research Electronic Data Capture (REDCap)  Utah and University-specific data sources (Utah Population Data Base and Enterprise Data Warehouse)  Data tools: Microsoft SQL, Python, R, or SAS  InfluxDB, MongoDB  Web development  The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management and data analysis. If the candidate is interested, there are also opportunities for conducting scientific analysis of data. Testing and experimentation: Standardize experimentation and testing processes and enable other analysts and data scientists to access the results using statistical software and a robust task management system. Lead design and execution of A/B tests, improve different digital testing methodologies and build related pipelines for collecting test results. Use different techniques for collecting test outcomes and evaluate them using a mix of Frequentist and Bayesian statistical methods to produce confidence intervals for different outcomes. EDA: Mine data from the enterprise data warehouse and other third-party tools to continuously improve marketing performance and Return On Investment (ROI). Provide ROI metrics for initiatives and activities by utilizing Exploratory-Data-Analytics methods to furnish different metrics like standard deviations, variance, skew, kurtosis etc. to rank and prioritize different business undertakings based on profit maximization. Apply graphical and quantitative techniques such as scatter plots, box-plots and quantiles (percentiles, deciles etc.) to describe key metrics and find correlations. Discover patterns, check assumptions and spot anomalies to reduce the number of hypotheses to a manageable amount and run significance tests on. Conduct business cases analysis to support new initiatives and activities. Program different mathematical software such as Prophet/ARIMA to forecast different metrics, justify decisions and new activities. Data-operations: Utilize tools and technologies (Teradata, Micro Strategy, Excel, R-Studio, Python, Snowflake, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, HIVE, and HDFS) in the analysis of a large array of data (sales, customer, behavioral, and website). Develop end-to-end analytics pipelines that can automate collection, cleaning, processing and visualization of data from distinct data environments such as SQL, Hadoop, Apache Spark by using a combination of tools such as R, Python and VBA. QA and clean different data flows between multiple systems in a reproducible fashion to ensure data integrity, quality. Select different key attributes to check across multiple systems by using similar aggregation functions to ensure integrity (data validation). Convert data from different data formats such as JSON, XML and CSV into data frames and relational tables for easy consumption and processing. Modeling and inference: Utilize techniques such as regressions, tree-based models etc. to confirm business assumptions and identify important factors to drive efficiency. Develop an extensive understanding of data pipelines and Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) to understand caveats in the data. Collaborate with Business and Development teams to understand business requirements and functional specifications Product and experience analytics: Understand robust tracking and collection of data from multiple tools like Adobe, Google Analytics, HDFS etc. Develop methods to quantify the customer experience on the website and improve the experience through testing, modeling and data-driven hypothesis generation. Identify frequently-purchased-together-products using A Priori algorithms that calculate lift and confidence between two SKUs for better product recommendations and site-flows. Develop and utilize knowledge of various CRM systems and integrate customer data with internal systems to build comprehensive customer profiles, clusters and value groups to improve the browsing experience through personalization. job_title: Health Data Analyst I, II, or III or Data Scientist
location: 560 E 200 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84102
job_Description: About The Company: PEHP Health & Benefits is a division of the Utah Retirement Systems that proudly serves Utah’s public employees through high quality and competitively priced medical, dental, life, and long-term disability insurance plans on a self-funded basis. As a government entity, we embrace both a public mission and a commitment to creating customer value, excelling in the market, and improving healthcare. We offer a competitive salary with generous benefits, personal development in a positive team environment, and excellent work-life balance. Job Description: HEALTH DATA ANALYST I FLSA: NON-EXEMPT POSITION SUMMARY Performs data analysis on healthcare data using database queries, spreadsheets, and data visualization software. Responsible for highlighting insights, key takeaways and summarizing results from large datasets in a manner that is easy to understand. Plays an important role in supporting the reporting function for recurring external group reports. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES Writes SQL queries to pull data (medical, pharmacy and dental claims; eligibility; premium; lab results & biometrics; predictive model outputs like risk scores and risk of hospitalization measures). Optimizes queries for speed and ensures the accuracy of the data. Defines the scope of the data analytic requests by clarifying and documenting what questions the end-user is trying to answer and how the results of the analysis will be used after it is delivered. After completion of analysis, performs necessary follow-up to ensure analysis meets expectations and that end-user understands how to interpret it. Builds visually intuitive Tableau dashboards that are easy to use to answer likely questions from the end-user. Optimizes visualization speed with common filter interactions. Sets up automatic data refreshes, trains end-user in any functionality of dashboard, and schedules regular follow-ups with end-users to see if there are questions or feedback. Uses Excel to perform advanced ad hoc analytical projects that involve text parsing, lookups, pivot tables, and graphs in a timely manner. Assists in updating recurring reports. Investigates and takes action to correct any discrepancy in the data to ensure the integrity of the reports. Presents data and conclusions to department and manager for peer review. Finds meaningful insights from large data sets and assigned analytical assignments and succinctly summarizes and presents conclusions and key takeaways to others. Finds ways to automate and streamline projects and reports that are commonly recurring. Maintains strict confidentiality. Performs other related duties as required. HEALTH DATA ANALYST II FLSA: NON-EXEMPT POSITION SUMMARY Performs data and statistical analysis on healthcare data using database queries, spreadsheets, programming languages, statistical software, and data visualization software. Responsible for highlighting insights, key takeaways and summarizing results from large datasets in a manner that is easy to understand and digest for both technical and non-technical audiences within PEHP. Helps build, manage or enhance underwriting models or data analysis that support the underwriting process. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES Uses looped queries and/or stored procedures to build extracts to support data visualizations. Writes SQL queries to pull data (medical, pharmacy and dental claims; eligibility; premium; lab results & biometrics; predictive model outputs like risk scores and risk of hospitalization measures). Optimizes queries for speed and ensures the accuracy of the data. Defines the scope of the data analytic requests by clarifying and documenting what questions the end-user is trying to answer and how the results of the analysis will be used after it is delivered. After completion of analysis, performs necessary follow-up to ensure analysis meets expectations and that the end-user understands how to interpret it. Uses statistical analysis to create and/or apply predictive analytics that improves the underwriting, clinical/case management, or provider relations contracting/management processes. Builds and supports advanced Tableau dashboards that are stable tools for other departments within PEHP and are regularly being enhanced based on the end-users’ feedback. Helps build, manage, and/or enhance UW models (manual rate, risk score, small-group automated and large group stand-alones). Helps build, manage, and/or enhance data analysis that supports the UW process (e.g. trend driver, UW dashboard, etc.). Presents data and conclusions to other departments within PEHP. Investigates and takes action to correct any discrepancy in the data to ensure the integrity of the reports. Finds ways to automate and streamline projects and reports that are commonly recurring. Maintains strict confidentiality. Performs other related duties as required. HEALTH DATA ANALYST III FLSA: EXEMPT POSITION SUMMARY Performs complex analysis on healthcare data using database queries, spreadsheets, programming languages, statistical software, and data visualization software. Responsible for highlighting insights, key takeaways, and summarizing results from large datasets in a manner that is easy to understand and digest for internal and external audiences. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES Develops predictive analytics to support actionable insights, allocate limited resources, and help guide rate setting process. Uses familiarity with healthcare data to extract and summarize the appropriate data elements for statistical model. Uses statistical software to construct, validate, and tune a predictive model. Implements model results into business processes. Acts as content expert for data related to the assigned PEHP internal customer area. Supports PEHP internal customer area in reporting, research, data exploration, and embedding actionable data insights into business workflow. Gains familiarity of relevant data sources and writes SQL queries/stored procedures to extract and analyze data. Builds dashboards and/or other tools or reports as requested by the customer. May involve statistical analysis to verify/highlight potential insights from data. Provides analytical support of PEHP enterprise level initiatives. Works with databases, software programming, and or statistical analysis to help develop analytical tools that help support the division’s strategic initiatives. Presents technical results to non-technical audience. Clearly articulates, summarizes, and describes technical concepts in a way that non-technical audience can understand. Uses data visualizations and summaries to intuitively highlight key takeaways. Supports internal and external reporting. Supports annual HEDIS reports and the accompanying audit, actionable insight report design, and implementation for employer groups, and/or automation of regular periodic reports to both internal/external customers. Mentors, supports, and provides guidance to Health Data Analysts I and II, as assigned. Supports underwriting functions as needed. Maintains strict confidentiality. Performs other related duties as required. DATA SCIENTIST FLSA: EXEMPT POSITION SUMMARY Combined use of high-level statistics, programming, and healthcare expertise to provide solutions and models that uncover actionable interventions that help PEHP bring value to its customers. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES Selects features, builds and optimizes classifiers, using machine learning techniques and data mining, programming, statistics, and healthcare expertise. Enhances data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems and creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance. Works with databases, software programming, and/or statistical analysis to help develop analytical tools that support the development and maintenance of a relevant and insightful data repository. Develops predictive analytics to support actionable insights, allocate limited resources, and help guide rate setting process. Uses familiarity with healthcare data to extract and summarize the appropriate data elements for statistical model. Uses statistical software to construct, validate, and tune a predictive model. Implements model results into business processes. Monitors landscape of evolving technologies and best practices and contributes to ongoing evolution of analytics and data-driven decision making within the organization. Actively searches for and find areas for process improvement within the division. Stays abreast of recent developments in relevant technologies. Helps to create an environment where good data practice flows through the division. Presents methods and findings to both non-technical and technical audience internal/external to PEHP. Clearly articulates, summarizes and describes technical concepts in a way that non-technical audience can understand. Uses data visualizations and summaries to intuitively highlight key takeaways. Mentors actuaries and analysts through seminars and building tools for others to use. Maintains strict confidentiality. Performs other related duties as required. Required Experience: HEALTH DATA ANALYST I Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or clinical field and one (1) year of data analysis experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge of Tableau is preferred. Experience related to health care or data formats associated with medical, pharmacy and dental claims is preferred. Extensive knowledge of SQL and/or programming (VBA, Python or similar languages) is preferred. Employee Applicant Privacy Notice  Who we are:  Welcoming, collaborative and having the opportunity to make an impact - is how our employees describe working here. Galileo is a financial technology company that provides innovative and revolutionary software products and services that power some of the world's largest Fintechs. We are the only payments innovator that applies tech and engineering capabilities to empower Fintechs and financial institutions to unleash their full creativity to achieve their most inspired goals. Galileo leads its industry with superior fraud detection, security, decision-making analytics and regulatory compliance functionality combined with customized, responsive and flexible programs to accelerate the success of all payments companies and solve tomorrow's payments challenges today. We hire energetic and creative employees while providing them the opportunity to excel in their careers and make a difference for our clients. Learn more about us and why we work here at https://www.galileo-ft.com/working-at-galileo. #LI-SH1   The role:  Galileo is seeking a Senior Data Scientist who will help shape business decisions through data-driven insights. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on the business.  Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen: you know how to plow through data with SQL/Python/R/Tableau, surface insights using math/statistics/ML techniques, and measure the business impact using efficiency/conversion/profit metrics. You treat stakeholders as a partnership – you are there at each step of the way and you know that we only succeed if we succeed together.  What you'll do:   Contribute to the design, orchestration, and development of ongoing Data Science projects.  Assist in development of tools/frameworks needed to carry out projects.  Analyze data sources, and test hypotheses in order to improve existing, and future models.  Present, visualize, and communicate findings internally and externally.  Adapt to new languages/technologies.  Develop and test data-driven strategies that optimize core product decisions such as funnel conversion, product experimentation, prospect targeting, and web page optimization  Build models to help decision makers understand customer behaviors and segmentation  Run significance tests and continuously discover trends in customer behavior to inform decision making with a high level of confidence  Build reporting pipelines and dashboards to deliver results of credit card strategies to the business  Present analyses to business leaders in the Lending organization   What you'll need:   Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field (Computer science, Mathematics, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent experience.  Proven track record of end-to-end experience in building analytical frameworks to inform business strategy;  5+ years of experience working in an analytics role in Finance or Tech  Strong programming skills in SQL, Python and proficiency in Tableau  Strong programming skills in Python Data Science stack. (Pandas, sklearn, numpy)  Experience with using Airflow to build Data Pipelines  Ability to work in a dynamic, cross-functional environment, with a strong attention to detail;  Effective communication and presentation skills and ability to explain complex analyses in simple terms to business leaders;  Strong relationship building and collaborative skills;  Exceptional problem-solving skills;  Knowledge and experience of writing and turning SQL queries, packages, and procedures.  Experience in an ML Framework (PyTorch, Tensorflow).  Experience with Version Control.  Industry experience in Data Science context.  Experience in experimental design, analysis, testing, and deployment. (A/B Testing, CI/CD, Unit Testing)  Nice to have:  Experience with AWS tech stack for Data Science including SageMaker, S3, EC2, EMR  Experience in Pytorch.  Experience with Docker.  Experience with Oracle SQL or AWS RDS/Redshift.  Experience with Deep Learning (RNN's, Transformers, LSTM).  Experience with Time Series analysis, Imbalanced classification, Outlier detection or Fraud Detection.  Experience in the finance sector.  Why you'll love working here:   Competitive salary packages and bonuses  Comprehensive medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits  Generous vacation and holidays  Paid parental leave for eligible employees  401(k) and education on retirement planning Retirement plans and planning  Tuition reimbursement on approved programs  Monthly contribution up to $200 to help you pay off your student loans  Great health & well-being benefits including: telehealth parental support, subsidized gym program  Fully stocked kitchen (snacks and drinks)  Galileo Financial Technologies provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law. Due to the ongoing nature of the COVID-19 pandemic, and because unvaccinated employees pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others in the workplace, effective on November 1, 2021, U.S. employees must be fully vaccinated to work from any of our offices, travel for business or attend work-related meetings.  The company will make reasonable accommodations when possible for employees who are unable to be vaccinated because of a disability, pregnancy, sincerely held religious belief, or for other legally required reasons. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without. Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career. We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours? The Challenge:  As a data scientist in the Qualtrics Global Customer Intelligence team, you will develop models using customer feedback, product usage and operational data which will strategically advance how Qualtrics measures, understands, improves, and innovates the experiences it delivers to its customers.  What Success Looks Like:  In this role, you will support Qualtrics’ customer-facing teams with your expertise in data science. You will be part of a growing analytics team that serves our customer service teams with insights that can be turned into action. Whether you’re speaking with the Head of Customer Success, Global Operations or Product Delivery, you'll constantly be challenged to come up with new and creative solutions to help Qualtrics meet the needs of our customers.  Bring your analytical mind, problem-solving skills, and deep expertise in statistics and machine learning to turn data into insights that drive action our team can take to improve their customer experience and business outcomes. If you love solving problems with statistical theory, hands on coding, hacking, partnering with cross-functional teams and thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, this position is for you!  A Day in the Life:  Design, develop, and program methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions t  Interact with cross-functional business stakeholders to understand their questions and issues and formulate approaches for data analysis and experiments  Develop and code software programs, algorithms, and automated processes to cleanse, integrate, and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources  Identify meaningful insights and findings from large data and metadata sources; interpret and communicate insights and findings from analysis and experiments in ways business audiences understand  Clearly communicate complex modeling outcomes and insights to business stakeholders  Be an internal leader in statistics including descriptive statistics, correlation, and regression  Form collaborative relationships with key stakeholders and team members  Qualifications & Requirements  Master’s Degree in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, or Data Science, with a BA/BS in Economics, Finance, Management, Marketing, or Social Science  5+ years work experience  At least 3+ years experience in open source programming languages  At least 3+ years experience with machine learning  Fluent in Python or R, able to query data using SQL, has experience working with cloud-based computing platforms and big data tools  Strong verbal and written skills to present analysis and insights including trends and opportunities to stakeholders across the business  Able to work independently on projects with little to no guidance required  High standard of quality, attention to detail, and professionalism  Preferred Qualifications  Familiarity with survey scripting and data reporting platforms such as Qualtrics is desired  Ph.D. in quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, etc.

job_title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test - Data Science
job_Description: About Ancestry:  When you join Ancestry, you join a human-centered company where every person’s story is important. We believe that by discovering the struggles and triumphs of our past, we can foster deeper bonds and more meaningful connections among families and communities. Our talented team of scientists, engineers, genealogists, historians, and storytellers is dedicated to empowering customers around the world from all backgrounds on their journeys of personal discovery. With more than 30+ billion digitized global historical records, 100+ million family trees, and 20+ million people in our growing AncestryDNA database, Ancestry helps customers discover their family story and gain a new level of understanding about their lives. Passionate about dedicating your work to enriching people’s lives? You belong at Ancestry. Ancestry is looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer in Test to join our Data Science Engineering team in Lehi, Utah or San Francisco, CA. You will have a broad background in backend testing and strong Java development skills. You will be very comfortable programmatically reading a wide variety of data sets from different data sources (flat files, databases, S3), transforming that data into different input formats (SQS, SNS, REST endpoint), creating complex tests to inject that data into integration points in the system, reading the results and doing detailed comparisons of actual versus expected results. You will... Work with AWS technologies such as S3, SQS, SNS, CloudWatch and know how to work with the various Java SDKs to access those resources as part of their tests. Interpret load graphs, troubleshoot and isolate performance problems using different tools like Blazemeter, New Relic and VisualVM. Use quality metrics and tools to measure and publish those metrics; ie: SonarQube, JaCoCo/EMMA, Checkstyle, PMD and other linters. Effectively collaborate with a diverse set of engineers, data scientists and leaders to promote quality. Who you are... BS Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience required 3+ years related experience Experience with Java integration testing frameworks and data-driven testing: TestNG/Junit, REST-Assured, RESTful APIs, Postman Experience with deployment pipelines, specifically Jenkins Experience with AWS technologies, writing to and reading from:  S3, SNS, SQS, Lambda, Fargate, Terraform, Redshift, Databricks Experience with manipulating JSON to create payloads and extract specific information using Java libraries Experience with load testing and associated tools:  JMeter, Blazemeter Solid understanding of load testing principles, types of tests and when to use them Experience with Java required and Python preferred Working knowledge of GitHub, Jenkins, Docker, IntelliJ IDEA, JMeter, and SonarQube #LI-TCC IND2 #GDSponsored Additional Information:  Ancestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition, Ancestry will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. All job offers are contingent on a background check screen that complies with applicable law. For San Francisco office candidates, pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Ancestry will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Ancestry is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ancestry via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ancestry. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Ancestry as a result of the referral or through other means.

The Data Management Senior Data Analyst works with various teams within Willis Towers Watson to perform testing, troubleshooting, reporting on carrier data feeds, as well as work with Microsoft Excel, SQL and internal systems. In addition, the Senior Data Analyst provides general knowledge to Carrier Data teams on system functionality and processes. This position is responsible for being the technical experts regarding Enrollment and Premium Files. The Senior Data Analyst will vet work requests and ensure that all requirements have been provided in order to help resolve any concerns/discrepancies. Senior Data Analysts track progress of tickets and projects from start to finish within established deadlines. The Senior Data Analyst position is a carrier facing role where clear and concise communication is a must.  The Senior Data Analyst will work on a team consisting of other Senior Data Analysts and Analysts. This role will require them to assist in other duties that may not be listed to assist other Analysts as needed.  Responsibilities  Ensure that internal and external service levels are met in a timely and high-quality manner  Work with internal departments (call center, development, product, and client) to assure smooth internal operations  Help facilitate ingestion, manipulation, loading, maintenance, and delivery of data for new product and new carrier partners  Resolve escalated issues in a timely manner to promote customer satisfaction  Maintain data with the highest level of accuracy  Create and maintain technical specification documents  Ad-Hoc reporting using SQL Server, Azure, and Power BI  Provide QA testing in coordination with carriers  Other duties as assigned  Have the ability to complete self-led learning  Maintain proactive communication throughout projects and daily tasks  Apply problem solving skills both technically and generally  Teach skills and processes throughout own team and internal departments  Project manage/lead for the Senior Data Analyst team   Note that visa employment-based non-immigrant visa sponsorship and/or assistance is not offered for this specific job opportunity.  Qualifications  Medicare and Individual Family Plan knowledge  Self-motivated, highly analytical, organized and uncompromisingly detail-oriented  Advanced time-management skills and the ability to meet or exceed deadlines in a fast-paced environment  Very knowledgeable of delimited file conventions, other industry standard data formats, data transmission methodologies, and Microsoft Excel  5+ years of experience with Microsoft Excel  2+ years of experience with SQL (SQL Server or other) and use of ETL tools  Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to relate well to others and understand their concerns  Positive, proactive attitude  Technical documentation writing  Negotiation and conflict resolution skills  Data trend identification and resolution  Ability to work well with a team as well as on individually assigned projects  Proven ability to develop and improve processes to drive efficiency  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Consistent in meeting deadlines and following through on commitments  Familiarity with Medicare a plus  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience   Willis Towers Watson may be subject to mandatory employment-related COVID-19 vaccination requirements. Therefore, to the extent any such mandates apply, you may be required to certify and provide documentation of full vaccination against COVID-19 if you are hired in the U.S. If you accept an offer from WTW and are subject to a mandate but are unable or unwilling to be vaccinated because of medical reasons or sincerely-held religious beliefs, you may request a medical or religious accommodation. If you require an accommodation, the Company will evaluate your request and work with you to identify reasonable alternatives to vaccination, if available.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Vet/Disability
